title: Volodymyr Zelenskyy: Ukraine, War, Peace, Putin, Trump, NATO, and Freedom | Lex Fridman Podcast #456

metadata.summary: In this episode, Lex Fridman interviews Volodymyr Zelenskyy, President of Ukraine, in a wide-ranging discussion about the ongoing war with Russia. They delve into the complexities of peace negotiations, the roles of key figures like Putin and Trump, and the importance of international support. Zelenskyy shares his perspectives on NATO, security guarantees, and the challenges of maintaining unity and fighting corruption during wartime. The conversation also touches on the impact of language, the role of digitalization, and the future of Ukraine in a rapidly changing world.

topClaims.text: Vladimir Putin is ready to talk to Ukraine regarding negotiations.
Ukraine's security guarantees relied on its possession of nuclear weapons, and their absence has made the country more vulnerable in the current war.
NATO will ultimately prevent Ukraine from going against Russia.

topQuotes.text: Putin wants to sit down and talk, but Ukraine does not.
We spoke in a mix of languages, continuously switching from Ukrainian to Russian to English.
If we do not have security guarantees, Putin will come again.
Ukraine had nuclear weapons. Today, the fact that we do not have them is bad.

topTopics.description: The importance of security guarantees and NATO.

Volodymyr Zelenskyy is the President of Ukraine. This episode is available in English, Ukrainian, and Russian. Captions and voice-over audio tracks are provided in English, Ukrainian, Russian, and the original mixed-language version, with subtitles available in your preferred language. To listen to the original mixed language version, please select the English (UK) audio track audio track. The default is English overdub.
Thank you for listening ❤ Check out our sponsors: https://lexfridman.com/sponsors/ep456-sb
